root_causes.description: High volume of AR exceptions ($2.6M) indicates potential data entry errors or incomplete reconciliations.
Bank duplicate records (13 instances) suggest gaps in reconciliation processes or system controls.
root_causes.financial_impact: Potential misstatements in cash balances due to duplicate records

root_causes.description: AP exceptions ($653.9K) may result from integration issues between sub-ledgers and the general ledger.

remediations.action: Conduct a detailed review of AR exception records to identify and correct data entry errors. Implement validation checks to prevent recurrence.
remediations.success_criteria: Reduction in AR exceptions to below materiality thresholds (<$50K).

remediations.action: Enhance bank reconciliation processes by implementing automated duplicate detection and resolution workflows.
remediations.estimated_effort: 3-4 weeks with 1 FTE and IT support
remediations.success_criteria: Elimination of duplicate bank records in future periods.

remediations.action: Investigate AP sub-ledger to GL integration for discrepancies. Resolve mapping or configuration issues causing exceptions.
remediations.estimated_effort: 4-6 weeks with 2 FTEs and IT support
remediations.success_criteria: Reduction in AP exceptions to below materiality thresholds (<$50K).
